Key Match Events: The Athletics laid down four bunts in the game, including three consecutive bunts in the top of the 12th inning, en route to the eventual 4-3 win.
Max Schuemann bunted towards Astros pitcher Hector Neris, who appeared to lose his footing as he fielded the ball, resulting in a feeble throw homeâ€”and a run-scoring sacrifice for Oakland.
infielder Nick Allen delivered the knockout punch: a pop-up bunt that Yainer Diaz narrowly missed catching, allowing Cameron to race home to give the Athletics a 4-2 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Mark Kotsay noted the Athletics' small-ball approach was undoubtedly effective and well-executed.
Houston's less-than-stellar defense was also mentioned as a factor in the game's outcome.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went into 12 innings before the Athletics' winning bunts.
The Athletics' small-ball approach was aided by Houston's less-than-stellar defense.
Others: The game was played at Minute Maid Park.
